alert.note: Alert for Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 7:09PM EST until January 11 at 10:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by recent excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen and southeast New York, including the following county, Rockland. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 705 PM EST, the Hackensack River at New Milford Gauge reported 6.61 ft, which is minor flooding. Minor flooding is expected to continue through this evening. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hirshfeld Brook, Cherry Brook, Hudson River, Passaic River, Sparta Brook, Tenakill Brook, Sparkill Creek, Bear Brook, Pocantico River, Overpeck Creek, Cresskill Brook, Losen Slofe, Mill Creek, Hackensack River, Sprout Brook, Berrys Creek and Herring Brook. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hackensack, Bergenfield, Rutherford, Nanuet, Ridgefield, Nyack, Tappan, Fort Lee, Englewood, Pearl River, Oradell, Norwood, Orangeburg, Teterboro, Teaneck, Lodi, Cliffside Park, Palisades Park, Dumont and New Milford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
